summary: This document provides an overview of Jeffrey Epstein's net worth, detailing his career as a financier and philanthropist, as well as his legal troubles. It highlights his financial achievements, including the founding of his own firm and his significant real estate holdings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is described as an American financier and philanthropist with a net worth of $2 billion. The document outlines his career trajectory and legal issues.

events.title: Conviction for Soliciting Prostitution
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein served 13 months in jail out of an 18-month sentence after being convicted of soliciting an underage girl for prostitution.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's net worth is estimated at $2 billion.
He was born on January 20, 1953, in Brooklyn, New York.
Epstein founded his own financial management firm in 1962.
He has significant real estate holdings, including a villa in Palm Beach and a ranch in New Mexico.
In 2008, he was convicted of soliciting an underage girl for prostitution.
